title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezekiel chapter 14 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezekiel Chapter 14.

questions.question: Who came unto Ezekiel and sat before him according to Ezekiel 14:1?
options: Certain of the elders of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Certain of the elders of Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:1 states that certain of the elders of Israel came unto Ezekiel and sat before him.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 14:3, what have these men set up in their heart?
questions.correctAnswer: Idols
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:3 mentions that these men have set up their idols in their heart.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 14:4, what determines how the LORD will answer a man who comes to the prophet?
questions.correctAnswer: The multitude of his idols
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:4 says that the LORD will answer according to the multitude of his idols.

questions.question: What does God say the house of Israel is estranged from in Ezekiel 14:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Me (God)
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:5 states the house of Israel is estranged from God through their idols.

questions.question: What does God command the house of Israel to do in Ezekiel 14:6?
options: Repent and turn from their idols
questions.correctAnswer: Repent and turn from their idols
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:6 instructs the house of Israel to repent and turn away from their idols and abominations.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 14:7 says that even strangers in Israel who set up idols will be answered by the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:7 includes strangers sojourning in Israel who separate themselves by setting up idols and seeking prophets, and the LORD will answer them by Himself.

questions.question: What will God make the man who sets up idols and seeks the prophet become according to Ezekiel 14:8?
questions.correctAnswer: A sign and a proverb
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:8 says God will set His face against that man and make him a sign and a proverb and cut him off from the people.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 14:9, what will happen if the prophet is deceived when he speaks?
options: The LORD has deceived the prophet and will destroy him
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD has deceived the prophet and will destroy him
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:9 states that if the prophet is deceived, it is because the LORD has deceived him, and He will destroy the prophet from Israel.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Ezekiel 14:14: 'Though these three men, ____, Daniel, and Job, were in it, they should deliver but their own souls by their righteousness.'
questions.correctAnswer: Noah
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:14 lists Noah, Daniel, and Job as three men whose righteousness would only deliver their own souls.

questions.question: What will God send upon the land when it sins grievously according to Ezekiel 14:13?
questions.correctAnswer: Famine
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:13 mentions that God will send famine upon the land when it sins grievously.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezekiel 14:16, even if Noah, Daniel, and Job were in a land, they would deliver their sons and daughters as well as themselves.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:16 clearly states these men would only deliver themselves, not their sons or daughters.

questions.question: Which four sore judgments does God say He will send upon Jerusalem in Ezekiel 14:21?
options: Sword, famine, noisome beast, and pestilence
questions.correctAnswer: Sword, famine, noisome beast, and pestilence
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:21 lists these four sore judgments God will send upon Jerusalem.

questions.question: What will be left in Jerusalem after God’s judgments according to Ezekiel 14:22?
options: A remnant of sons and daughters
questions.correctAnswer: A remnant of sons and daughters
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:22 says there will be a remnant brought forth, both sons and daughters, after the judgments.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 14:23 states that the people will be comforted when they see the ways and doings of the remnant.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:23 confirms that the people will be comforted when they observe the remnant's ways and doings.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 14:10, who bears the punishment of the iniquity?
options: Both the prophet and the one seeking him
questions.correctAnswer: Both the prophet and the one seeking him
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:10 explains that the punishment of the prophet is the same as the punishment of the one who seeks him.

medium.title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezekiel Chapter 14 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with temptation to compromise their faith by following idols secretly. Based on Ezekiel 14, what biblical truth would you share about faithfulness?
options: Idols in the heart cause estrangement from God and hinder sincere prayer
God ignores those who fail to attend synagogue regularly
Only public sins are punishable by God
God answers prayers regardless of the worshipper's heart condition
questions.correctAnswer: Idols in the heart cause estrangement from God and hinder sincere prayer
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:3-5 shows that setting up idols in the heart causes separation from God and affects how God responds to prayer, emphasizing the need for faithfulness and purity of heart.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 14 teach about repentance and turning from sin in personal devotion?
options: Repent and turn away from idols and abominations
Repentance is unnecessary if you attend religious services
Confession alone is sufficient without turning from sin
questions.correctAnswer: Repent and turn away from idols and abominations
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:6 commands the house of Israel to repent and turn away from idols and abominations, highlighting true repentance involves turning from sin, not just confession.

questions.question: If a prophet is deceived in speaking God's word because of the people’s sin, what does Ezekiel 14 say God will do?
options: God will stretch out His hand and destroy the prophet from among the people
God will forgive the prophet without consequence
God will send another prophet immediately
God will keep the prophet as a lesson to others
questions.correctAnswer: God will stretch out His hand and destroy the prophet from among the people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:9 states that if a prophet is deceived, God will stretch out His hand upon him and destroy him among the people, showing the seriousness of integrity in spiritual leadership.

questions.question: A Christian is discouraged after seeing widespread sin in the church. Based on Ezekiel 14, what hope can you share about God's discipline and restoration?
options: God will leave a remnant who will be a comfort and show His purpose in correction
God will completely abandon the people forever
God only disciplines individuals, not groups
God’s punishment has no redemptive purpose
questions.correctAnswer: God will leave a remnant who will be a comfort and show His purpose in correction
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:22-23 explains that although judgment comes, God will preserve a remnant whose ways will bring comfort and reveal that God's actions are just.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 14 teach about seeking God through a prophet when one has idols in their heart?
options: God will answer according to the multitude of idols in the heart
God answers with blessings regardless of idols
questions.correctAnswer: God will answer according to the multitude of idols in the heart
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:4 states that God answers those who come with idols in their hearts according to the multitude of their idols, indicating that spiritual compromise affects divine communication.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 14 encourage humility and reliance on God rather than on human righteousness?
options: Even great righteous men can only save themselves, not others
Human righteousness guarantees salvation for families
Righteousness is unnecessary if one is part of Israel
Faith in idols can replace righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Even great righteous men can only save themselves, not others
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:14-20 shows that even Noah, Daniel, and Job, known for righteousness, could only save themselves, emphasizing reliance on God rather than on human merit.

questions.question: A believer feels tempted to compromise integrity at work. Based on Ezekiel 14, what principle about honesty and consequences can be drawn?
options: Sin leads to estrangement and consequences that affect the whole community
Dishonesty at work is overlooked if you pray
Consequences come only after repeated offenses
questions.correctAnswer: Sin leads to estrangement and consequences that affect the whole community
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:5 and 14:10 explain that sin causes estrangement from God and that both the sinner and those connected bear punishment, illustrating the importance of integrity.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezekiel 14, God’s judgments like famine, sword, pestilence, and beasts are sent randomly without warning or purpose.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:21-23 explain that God's judgments serve a purpose to cut off sin and bring about repentance, and He does not act without cause.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 14 teaches that idols in the heart can become a stumbling block that hinders a believer’s relationship with God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:3-4 highlights that idols in the heart are called a stumbling block of iniquity that lead to estrangement from God.

questions.question: When the land sins grievously, what does Ezekiel 14 say God will do as a consequence?
options: Break the staff of bread, send famine, and cut off man and beast
Send only prophets to warn the people
Ignore the sin of the land
Bless the land despite the sin
questions.correctAnswer: Break the staff of bread, send famine, and cut off man and beast
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:13 describes God’s response to grievous sin by breaking the staff of bread and sending famine and death, teaching consequences of persistent sin.

questions.question: A parent wants to teach their child about God’s justice and mercy. Based on Ezekiel 14, what balanced truth could be shared?
options: God executes judgment but preserves a faithful remnant for future hope
God only punishes the wicked and ignores the righteous
God’s mercy means no one is ever punished
Judgment means complete destruction without hope
questions.correctAnswer: God executes judgment but preserves a faithful remnant for future hope
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:21-23 show that while God sends judgments, He also preserves a remnant to bring comfort and demonstrate His just purpose.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 14 teach about perseverance through trials and trusting God's justice?
options: Even in severe judgment, God’s purpose is to correct and ultimately restore His people
Trials indicate God’s rejection without hope
Only the strongest survive without God’s intervention
questions.correctAnswer: Even in severe judgment, God’s purpose is to correct and ultimately restore His people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:11 and 22-23 emphasize that God’s judgments are corrective, aimed at making Israel His people again and comforting through a preserved remnant.

questions.question: A church leader is tempted to mislead others for personal gain. According to Ezekiel 14, what warning is given about such behavior?
options: God will destroy a prophet who is deceived when speaking falsely
God will reward the leader for success
Misleading is acceptable if done with good intentions
God will overlook errors in leadership
questions.correctAnswer: God will destroy a prophet who is deceived when speaking falsely
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:9 warns that if a prophet is deceived in speaking, God will stretch out His hand and destroy him among the people, underscoring the seriousness of truthfulness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Ezekiel 14:7, anyone who separates themselves from God by setting up idols in their heart and seeking a prophet will have God answering them ___ .
questions.correctAnswer: by Himself
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:7 states that God will answer such a person by Himself, indicating direct judgment rather than blessing.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 14 instruct believers about dealing with sin in the family and community?
options: Both the seeker and the prophet bear punishment for sin
Only the individual sinner is punished
Family members are always spared from consequences
Punishment only comes after public confession
questions.correctAnswer: Both the seeker and the prophet bear punishment for sin
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:10 explains that the punishment of the prophet is like the punishment of the one who seeks him, teaching communal responsibility and accountability.

hard.title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezekiel Chapter 14.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 14, what is the primary reason God refuses to answer the elders of Israel who inquire of Him?
options: They have set up idols in their hearts and placed the stumblingblock of their iniquity before their faces
They did not offer sacrifices properly
They sought answers from false prophets
They were unclean according to Levitical law
questions.correctAnswer: They have set up idols in their hearts and placed the stumblingblock of their iniquity before their faces
questions.explanation: Verse Ezekiel 14:3 explains that the men have set up idols in their hearts and put the stumblingblock of their iniquity before their face, which is why God questions whether He should be inquired of by them.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 14, how will the LORD respond to a man of Israel who sets up idols in his heart and comes to a prophet to inquire of God?
options: He will answer him according to the multitude of his idols
He will reveal hidden mysteries to him
He will immediately forgive his sins
He will send an angel to guide him
questions.correctAnswer: He will answer him according to the multitude of his idols
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:4 states that the LORD will answer that man according to the multitude of his idols, indicating that the man's idolatry affects the nature of the response.

questions.question: Which three men are mentioned in Ezekiel 14 as examples of righteousness who could only deliver their own souls if they were in a sinful land?
questions.correctAnswer: Noah, Daniel, and Job
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:14 mentions Noah, Daniel, and Job as examples of righteousness who would only be able to save themselves if they were in the land under judgment.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ezekiel 14 states that when the land sins grievously, God will 'break the staff of the bread thereof,' which symbolizes ______.
questions.correctAnswer: famine
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:13 associates the 'staff of the bread' with sustenance, and God breaking it symbolizes sending famine upon the land.

questions.question: What literary device is primarily used in Ezekiel 14:14-20 to emphasize God's judgment despite the presence of righteous individuals?
questions.correctAnswer: Repetition and parallelism
questions.explanation: The passage repeats the scenario of three righteous men in different disaster contexts (famine, beasts, sword, pestilence) to emphasize that only their own souls would be saved, demonstrating parallelism.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 14, what will be the fate of the prophet if he is deceived in speaking to the people?
options: God will stretch out His hand upon him and destroy him from among the people
He will be forgiven if he repents
He will be replaced by another prophet
He will be exiled to a foreign land
questions.correctAnswer: God will stretch out His hand upon him and destroy him from among the people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:9 explains that if the prophet is deceived in speaking, the LORD will stretch out His hand upon him and destroy him among the people of Israel.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 14 teaches that the punishment of the prophet will be the same as the punishment of the one who seeks him for counsel.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:10 states that the punishment of the prophet will be even as the punishment of him who seeks unto him, indicating equal accountability.

questions.question: What is the intended purpose of God's judgments and discipline on Israel as described in Ezekiel 14:11?
options: So that Israel may no longer stray from God and may be His people
To punish them eternally without hope
To cause them to forget their covenants
questions.correctAnswer: So that Israel may no longer stray from God and may be His people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:11 declares that the punishment is so Israel may no longer go astray or be polluted, but may be God's people and He their God.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 14, what is the significance of the phrase 'I will make him a sign and a proverb' in relation to a man who sets up idols in his heart?
options: He will become a warning example to the people
He will be elevated as a leader
He will be hidden from others
questions.correctAnswer: He will become a warning example to the people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:8 indicates that God will set His face against the man and make him a sign and proverb, meaning he will be a negative example or warning to others.

questions.question: Which four sore judgments does God declare He will send upon Jerusalem in Ezekiel 14:21?
options: The sword, famine, noisome beasts, and pestilence
questions.correctAnswer: The sword, famine, noisome beasts, and pestilence
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:21 lists four judgments: sword, famine, noisome beasts, and pestilence, which will cut off man and beast from Jerusalem.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 14, what is the role of the 'remnant' that is left in Jerusalem after judgment?
options: They will be brought forth to show their way and doings and bring comfort
They will become priests in the temple
They will be exiled to Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: They will be brought forth to show their way and doings and bring comfort
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:22-23 states that a remnant of sons and daughters will be left, who will come forth and whose ways and doings will bring comfort and demonstrate God's justice.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 14 foreshadow the concept of individual responsibility found later in the New Testament?
options: By emphasizing that even the righteous will only save themselves in judgment
By promising universal salvation regardless of deeds
By focusing solely on national repentance
By affirming that only priests can intercede
questions.correctAnswer: By emphasizing that even the righteous will only save themselves in judgment
questions.explanation: The chapter underscores individual accountability; Noah, Daniel, and Job can only save their own souls, which parallels New Testament teachings on personal responsibility before God.

questions.question: What cultural or historical context is crucial to understanding the elders’ behavior in Ezekiel 14:1-3?
options: Ancient Near Eastern idol worship and Israel’s covenant unfaithfulness
The Babylonian exile and temple destruction
questions.correctAnswer: Ancient Near Eastern idol worship and Israel’s covenant unfaithfulness
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:1-3 reflects Israel's infiltration of surrounding idolatries, showing covenant unfaithfulness amidst the cultural context of the Ancient Near East.

questions.question: Which Hebrew term conceptually underpins the phrase 'stumblingblock of their iniquity' in Ezekiel 14:3, indicating a cause of sin or offense?
questions.correctAnswer: Mikhshol (מִכְשׁוֹל)
questions.explanation: 'Mikhshol' means a stumblingblock or cause of offense, fitting the phrase in Ezekiel 14:3 describing how idols cause sin and obstruction before God.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 14 implies that God’s judgments are arbitrary and without cause.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:23 clarifies that God’s actions are not without cause; the remnant's conduct will show that all God has done was justified.

theological.title: Ezekiel Chapter 14 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezekiel Chapter 14 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 14, what does God say about those who set up idols in their hearts and seek the prophet's counsel?
options: God will answer them according to the number of their idols
God will grant them peace and forgiveness
questions.correctAnswer: God will answer them according to the number of their idols
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:4 states that the LORD will answer the man who sets idols in his heart according to the multitude of his idols. This reflects God's holiness and justice in dealing with idolatry. Similar themes about God's judgment on idolatry appear in Exodus 20:5, Deuteronomy 5:9, and Romans 1:18-23.

questions.question: What warning does God give concerning prophets who are deceived in their speech, according to Ezekiel 14?
options: God will stretch out His hand and destroy that prophet from Israel
God will forgive the prophet after repentance
God will promote the prophet to leadership
God will silence the prophet temporarily
questions.correctAnswer: God will stretch out His hand and destroy that prophet from Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:9 says that if a prophet is deceived, God Himself has deceived the prophet and will destroy him from the midst of Israel. This highlights God's sovereignty and judgment on false prophecy, consistent with Deuteronomy 18:20-22 and Jeremiah 14:14.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 14, what is the purpose of God's judgment on Israel as expressed in verse 11?
options: That Israel may no longer stray from God and may be His people
questions.correctAnswer: That Israel may no longer stray from God and may be His people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:11 explains that God's judgment aims so the house of Israel will no longer stray or be polluted, but become His people and He their God. This is consistent with the covenantal purpose seen in Deuteronomy 7:6-9, Jeremiah 31:33, and 2 Corinthians 6:16.

questions.question: Which three righteous men does Ezekiel mention as examples who could only save themselves by their righteousness?
questions.correctAnswer: Noah, Daniel, and Job
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:14 and 14:20 mention Noah, Daniel, and Job as righteous men who could only deliver their own souls by their righteousness, illustrating that even the most righteous cannot save others from God's judgment apart from God's mercy. This aligns with Genesis 6:9, Daniel 6:22, Job 1:1, and Hebrews 11.

questions.question: What does God say will happen if He sends four sore judgments upon Jerusalem, according to Ezekiel 14?
options: He will cut off man and beast from it
He will immediately restore the city
He will cause the people to forget their sins
He will shield the city from harm
questions.correctAnswer: He will cut off man and beast from it
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:21 states that when God sends the sword, famine, noisome beasts, and pestilence, He will cut off man and beast from Jerusalem. This reflects God's righteous judgment consistent with Deuteronomy 28:15-68, Lamentations 2:1-22, and Revelation 6.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 14, what is meant by God making a man who sets up idols 'a sign and a proverb'?
options: The man will become an example of judgment among the people
The man will become a great leader
The man will be rewarded publicly
The man will be hidden from public view
questions.correctAnswer: The man will become an example of judgment among the people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:8 says God will set His face against the idolater and make him a sign and proverb, meaning he becomes a negative example to others. This is similar to Israel's history in Judges 9:7-15 and 1 Kings 13:33.

questions.question: What does God command the house of Israel to do in Ezekiel 14:6?
options: Repent and turn from idols and abominations
questions.correctAnswer: Repent and turn from idols and abominations
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:6 calls Israel to repentance and to turn away from idols and abominations, emphasizing God's desire for holiness and covenant faithfulness. This echoes calls to repentance in Joel 2:12-13, Isaiah 55:6-7, and Acts 3:19.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Ezekiel 14, God says if the land sins grievously, He will 'break the __________ of the bread thereof' and send famine.
questions.correctAnswer: staff
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:13 uses the metaphor of breaking the 'staff of the bread' to indicate removing sustenance and causing famine as judgment. This is consistent with imagery in 2 Kings 8:1, Psalm 78:25, and Revelation 6:5-6.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 14 say about the remnant left after God's judgments on Jerusalem?
options: A remnant of sons and daughters will be brought forth and will comfort the people
No one will be left alive
The city will be completely abandoned
questions.correctAnswer: A remnant of sons and daughters will be brought forth and will comfort the people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:22-23 promises a remnant left after judgment who will comfort those who witness their ways, showing God's mercy and faithfulness to His covenant. This theme of a faithful remnant appears in Isaiah 10:20-22, Romans 9:27, and Zechariah 8:12.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 14 describe God's personal involvement in answering those who set up idols and come to the prophet?
options: God says He will answer by Himself
God will delegate the answer to angels
God will let the prophet answer alone
questions.correctAnswer: God says He will answer by Himself
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:7 states that when idolaters come seeking the prophet, the LORD Himself will answer by Himself, signifying God's direct judgment. This underscores God's sovereignty, reflected in Exodus 3:14, Isaiah 45:22, and John 1:18.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'stumblingblock of their iniquity' in Ezekiel 14?
options: It refers to idols placed before their face causing sin
It means a physical stone they stumbled over
It is a metaphor for repentance
questions.correctAnswer: It refers to idols placed before their face causing sin
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:3 uses 'stumblingblock of their iniquity' to describe idols that cause people to sin. This concept of a stumblingblock is seen in Leviticus 19:14, Romans 14:13, and 1 Corinthians 8:9, illustrating how sin ensnares the heart.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 14, what will happen if noisome beasts spoil the land making it desolate?
options: The land will be desolate and no man may pass through
The beasts will be driven away by the people
The land will be blessed with new growth
The people will successfully hunt the beasts
questions.correctAnswer: The land will be desolate and no man may pass through
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:15 describes God sending noisome beasts that spoil the land making it desolate and impassable. This reflects divine judgment similar to descriptions in Jeremiah 14:6 and Revelation 8:7.

questions.question: Ezekiel 14 discusses God's judgment through pestilence. What does it say about the effect on families even with righteous individuals present?
options: Neither sons nor daughters will be delivered, only the righteous themselves
The righteous will protect their families
questions.correctAnswer: Neither sons nor daughters will be delivered, only the righteous themselves
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:19-20 states that even if Noah, Daniel, and Job were in the land during pestilence, only they themselves would be saved, not their children. This underscores individual responsibility and God's sovereignty in salvation, consistent with Ezekiel 18:4 and Romans 14:12.

questions.question: Why does God say He will take the house of Israel 'in their own heart' according to Ezekiel 14?
options: Because they are estranged from Him through their idols
Because they are faithful and obedient
Because they have built a new temple
questions.correctAnswer: Because they are estranged from Him through their idols
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:5 explains that God will take Israel in their own heart because their idolatry has estranged them from Him. This emphasizes the seriousness of idolatry seen also in Jeremiah 2:13, Hosea 4:12, and 1 Corinthians 10:14.

questions.question: What theological truth about God's justice is illustrated by the equal punishment of prophet and seeker described in Ezekiel 14?
options: Both share responsibility and bear equal punishment for iniquity
questions.correctAnswer: Both share responsibility and bear equal punishment for iniquity
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 14:10 teaches that the punishment of the prophet is like the one who seeks him, showing shared accountability. This aligns with principles of corporate responsibility in Leviticus 5:1, Ezekiel 18:20, and James 3:1.
